etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in The Observer. From progress + -ist; in many instances after equivalent terms in Romance languages, as French progressiste, Spanish progresista, adjective and noun, Italian progressista, adjective and noun

definitions: Favouring or characterized by innovation or reform; progressive.
A person who favours or advocates progress, especially in political or social matters; a reformer, a progressive.

notes.text: In political contexts now largely superseded by "progressive" except in rendering a word with a similar form and meaning from another language.
